results.title: Have a heart
results.creator_credit: Saul Rubin, Tantalus Films, Ken Plotin and Kaye Dyal
results.brief_description: Describes the function of the heart and circulatory system and emphasises the need for a healthy lifestyle to prevent heart disease. A heart attack victim is shown being given electric shock treatment. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Have a healthy baby: pregnancy. - Rev. ed. (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Spencer Peel, Churchill Films and Jane Treiman
results.brief_description: Follows the process of pregnancy, explaining how a baby develops, what a mother experiences, and what prenatal care is necessary to ensure a healthy baby. Animation details the important stages of growth of the human embryo from conception through pregnancy. Stresses the complexity of the process and the role nutrition, exercise and good health habits play.

results.title: Have a healthy baby
results.brief_description: Using animation, the film details the important stages of growth of the human embryo from conception to birth. There is major emphasis on the precise development of organ systems during the first three months. Ways that development may be disturbed, and the role played by good nutrition and health habits are also stressed.

results.title: Have a good day, dear
results.creator_credit: David Evans, Millbank Films and Ron Tanner
results.brief_description: Describes some of the more common hazards met with in offices. Intended for all levels of office staff, including management. Cast includes Geoffrey Hinsliffe, Jayne Lester, Caroline Dowdeswell.

results.title: Hausa village
results.creator_credit: Taurus Productions, Central Office of Information and Joan Duff
results.brief_description: Describes the Hausa people of northern Nigeria, a muslim people whose customs are often primitive, making a living from fishing and farming. The film is a survey of their communal life, their customs and culture, their ceremonies and traditions.

results.title: Haunting of Barney Palmer (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Barney Palmer was eight years old when his haunting began. Whispers in the waves, images in the mirror, voices in his dreams. Is it the ghost of his great Uncle Barnaby or is it the ghost of somebody not yet dead? Someone, somewhere in this world or in the next has promised to carry him away. For Barney, the answer lies close within the strength of his home.

results.title: Haunters of the deep
results.creator_credit: Gordon L.T. Scott, Longbow Film Company and Andrew Bogle
results.brief_description: In Cornwall, England, a big American company is about to re-open an abandoned tin mine, despite being warned against it. At the turn of the century the mine caved in and many miners were trapped beneath the surface. A ghost is sighted by a local boy - it is the ghost of one of the people trapped during the cave-in and it is trying to warn of disaster.

results.title: Hattie
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Barker, Debby Kingsland, Dept of Social Security and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
Hattie is seventy-six and completely alone, she has lost contact with a of her old friends and interests and feels that her life is now totally empty. Although she has always been happy and active, Hattie says she doesn’t care if she dies tomorrow, and that there are a lot of people like her, discarded because they are old. One of a series of films created originally for day- time television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies.

results.title: Hats in the Ring
results.brief_description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.
